page.title: 16WEBSTER'S NURSERIES
page.content:
The nursery is in the former kitchen garden of Freeland Lodge which used to be the home of the Taunton family and is now a private nursing home. Mr Webster's parents took it over in 1960 and he himself in 1973.
He keeps shrubs, geraniums, freesias, clematis, and hanging baskets. His best selling product is bedding plants, of which he sells 10,000 a year. In spring which is his busiest season, he makes hanging baskets and pots the bedding plants. In summer it is quiet so he clears up and prepares for autumn when he is busy selling shrubs, bulbs and soft fruit plants. In winter he sells Christmas trees and pot plants, does some seeding and builds up stocks for spring. His favourite plant is chrysanthemum and he loves bees.
